sen.j: 仁孝天皇（にんこうてんのう、寛政12年2月21日（1800年3月16日） - 弘化3年1月26日（1846年2月21日））は、第120代天皇（在位 文化 (元号)14年9月21日（1817年10月31日） - 弘化3年1月26日）。
sen.e: Emperor NINKO (March 16th, 1800 - February 21st, 1846) was the 12th Emperor. (his reign was October 31st, 1817 - unknown)
Emperor NINKO (March 16, 1800 - February 21, 1846) was the twelfth Emperor (his reign began on October 31, 1817, but the ending date is not known).
Emperor Ninko (March 16, 1800 - February 21, 1846) was the 120th Emperor (his reign was from October 31, 1817 to February 21, 1846).
sen.cmt: NINKO→Ninkotwelfth→120thbut the ending date is not known→- February 21, 1846 の翻訳修正

sen.e: His posthumous name was Ayahito.
His posthumous name was Ayahito.
His posthumous name was Ayahito.

tit.cmt: Biography→Brief Personal Historyに変更しました。

sen.j: 文化6年（1809年）3月24日、父帝の中宮欣子内親王（新清和院）の養子として立太子された。
sen.e: He became Crown Prince as an adopted son of his father's Chugu (second consort of an emperor), Princess Yoshiko (Shin-Seiwa in) on 24th March 1809.
sen.cmt: 中宮 the second consort of an Emperor 研究社新和英大辞典, 欣子内親王 Princess Yoshiko, 新清和院 Shin-Seiwa in
sen.e: He became the crown prince as an adopted son of his father's chugu (second consort of an emperor), Princess Yoshiko (Shin-Seiwa in), on March 24, 1809.
He became the crown prince as an adopted son of his father's chugu (second consort of an emperor), Princess Yoshiko (Shin-Seiwa in), on March 24, 1809.

sen.j: 文化14年（1817年）に即位し、父光格上皇の意をうけて朝儀復興に尽力した。
sen.e: The Emperor was enthroned in 1817 and he put his effort into reconstruction of the ceremony of Imperial court, which his father, Emperor KOKAKU wished him to do.
The Emperor was enthroned in 1817, and he put his efforts into the reconstruction of the ceremony of the Imperial Court, as his father, Emperor KOKAKU, wanted him to do.
The Emperor was enthroned in 1817, and he put his efforts into the reconstruction of the ceremony of the Imperial Court, as his father, Emperor Kokaku, wanted him to do.

sen.j: 皇族や公家の子弟のための教育機関の設置を志し、武家伝奏徳大寺実堅に江戸幕府との折衝を命じた。
sen.e: The Emperor aimed to establish an educational facility for Imperial families and court noble's children, he ordered Buke-denso/Buke-tenso (an imperial official in charge of communication between the samurai and the court), Sanemi Tokudaiji to negotiate with the government of Edo.
sen.cmt: 武家伝奏 an imperial official in charge of communication between the samurai and the court 研究社新和英大辞典, 徳大寺実堅 Sanemi Tokudaiji kotobank.jp, 江戸幕府 government of Edo
sen.e: The Emperor aimed to establish an educational facility for Imperial families and the children of court noble's, and ordered the buke-denso (buke-tenso) (an Imperial official in charge of communication between the samurai and the court), Sanemi Tokudaiji, to negotiate with the government of Edo.

The Emperor aimed to establish an educational facility for imperial families and the children of court nobles, and ordered the buke-denso (buke-tenso) (an imperial official in charge of communication between the samurai and the court), Sanemi TOKUDAIJI, to negotiate with the government of Edo.

sen.j: 幕府の了承を得てその構想が現実のものとなった矢先、崩御した。
sen.e: The Emperor died just after receiving the approval from the government and the plan was about to proceed.
The Emperor died just after receiving the approval from the government and the plan was about to proceed.
The Emperor died just after receiving the approval from the government and the plan was about to proceed.
He was forty seven years old.
He was 47 years old.
He was 47 years old.

sen.j: 崩御の翌年にあたる弘化4年（1847年）、天皇の遺志によって御所の建春門外に公家講学の所として学習所が設立された。
sen.e: After one year the Emperor died, an educational centre for court nobles was established outside of Kenshun mon Gate in the Imperial Palace, which was his last wish to make it happen.
sen.cmt: 御所 Imperial Ppalace 研究社新和英大辞典, 建春門 Kenshun mon Gate
sen.e: A year after the Emperor's death, an educational center for court nobles was established outside of Kenshun mon Gate in the Imperial Palace, thus realizing his last wish.
A year after the Emperor's death (1847), an educational center for court nobles was established outside of Kenshun mon Gate at the Imperial Palace, thus realizing his last wish.

sen.j: 明治天皇の命によって設立された現在の学習院大学の前身である。
sen.e: This is a predecessor of current Gakushuin University which was built by Emperor Meiji's order.
This was a predecessor of the current Gakushuin University, which was built by Emperor Meiji's order.
This was a predecessor of the current Gakushuin University, which was built by Emperor Meiji's order.

sen.j: 京都市東山区今熊野泉山町の後月輪陵（のちのつきのわのみささぎ）に葬られた。
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed in Nochi no Tsuki no Wa no Misasagi, Senzan-cho Town, Imagumano, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 京都市東山区今熊野泉山町 Senzan-cho Town, Imagumano, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City www.yu-bin.net, 後月輪陵 Nochi no Tsuki no Wa no Misasagi
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed at Nochi no Tsuki no Wa no Misasagi, Senzan-cho Town, Imagumano, Higashiyama ward, Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed at Nochi no Tsuki no Wa no Misasagi, Senzan-cho Town, Imagumano, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
